class Solution:
    def findMaxSum(self, a: List[int], b: List[int], k: int) -> List[int]:
        import heapq
        n=len(a)
        L=[(a[i],b[i],i) for i in range(n)]
        L.sort(key=lambda x:x[0])
        r=[0]*n
        h=[]
        s=0
        i=0
        while i<n:
            v=L[i][0]
            j=i
            while j<n and L[j][0]==v:
                r[L[j][2]]=s
                j+=1
            for p in range(i,j):
                y=L[p][1]
                if len(h)<k:
                    heapq.heappush(h,y)
                    s+=y
                elif y>h[0]:
                    t=heapq.heapreplace(h,y)
                    s+=y-t
            i=j
        return r

import heapq

class Solution:
    def findMaxSum(self, nums1, nums2, k):
        n = len(nums1)
        pairArr = []
        i = 0
        while i < n:
            pairArr.append((nums1[i], nums2[i], i))
            i += 1
        pairArr.sort(key=lambda x: x[0])
        ans = [0] * n
        heap = []
        currentSum = 0
        i = 0
        while i < n:
            j = i
            while j < n and pairArr[j][0] == pairArr[i][0]:
                j += 1
            p = i
            while p < j:
                origIdx = pairArr[p][2]
                ans[origIdx] = currentSum
                p += 1
            p = i
            while p < j:
                val = pairArr[p][1]
                heapq.heappush(heap, val)
                currentSum += val
                if len(heap) > k:
                    rem = heapq.heappop(heap)
                    currentSum -= rem
                p += 1
            i = j
        return ans
